channel.title: CVE Feed for Mozilla -- Firefox
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mozilla -- Firefox

item.title: CVE-2024-0745|2024-08-01T18:18:18.198Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The WebAudio `OscillatorNode` object was susceptible to a stack buffer overflow. This could have led to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-2609|2024-08-01T19:18:48.164Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The permission prompt input delay could expire while the window is not in focus. This makes it vulnerable to clickjacking by malicious websites. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-2613|2024-08-01T19:18:48.218Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Data was not properly sanitized when decoding a QUIC ACK frame; this could have led to unrestricted memory consumption and a crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.

item.title: CVE-2024-2612|2024-08-01T19:18:47.923Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If an attacker could find a way to trigger a particular code path in `SafeRefPtr`, it could have triggered a crash or potentially be leveraged to achieve code execution. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0750|2024-08-01T18:18:18.185Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A bug in popup notifications delay calculation could have made it possible for an attacker to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-2606|2024-08-01T19:18:48.194Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Passing invalid data could have led to invalid wasm values being created, such as arbitrary integers turning into pointer values. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.

item.title: CVE-2024-0747|2024-08-01T18:18:17.903Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When a parent page loaded a child in an iframe with `unsafe-inline`, the parent Content Security Policy could have overridden the child Content Security Policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-2614|2024-08-01T19:18:48.251Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 123, Firefox ESR 115.8, and Thunderbird 115.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0751|2024-08-01T18:18:18.576Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A malicious devtools extension could have been used to escalate privileges. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-2607|2024-08-01T19:18:48.107Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Return registers were overwritten which could have allowed an attacker to execute arbitrary code. *Note:* This issue only affected Armv7-A systems. Other operating systems are unaffected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0741|2024-08-01T18:18:18.323Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An out of bounds write in ANGLE could have allowed an attacker to corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-0744|2024-08-01T18:18:18.323Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In some circumstances, JIT compiled code could have dereferenced a wild pointer value. This could have led to an exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-0743|2024-08-01T18:18:18.499Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An unchecked return value in TLS handshake code could have caused a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-2615|2024-08-01T19:18:47.946Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 123. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.

item.title: CVE-2024-2608|2024-08-01T19:18:48.282Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: `AppendEncodedAttributeValue(), ExtraSpaceNeededForAttrEncoding()` and `AppendEncodedCharacters()` could have experienced integer overflows, causing underallocation of an output buffer leading to an out of bounds write. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0752|2024-08-01T18:18:18.341Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A use-after-free crash could have occurred on macOS if a Firefox update were being applied on a very busy system. This could have resulted in an exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-0755|2024-08-01T18:18:18.313Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 121, Firefox ESR 115.6, and Thunderbird 115.6. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-0746|2024-08-01T18:18:18.224Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A Linux user opening the print preview dialog could have caused the browser to crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-0748|2024-08-01T18:18:18.507Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A compromised content process could have updated the document URI. This could have allowed an attacker to set an arbitrary URI in the address bar or history. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-2605|2024-08-01T19:18:48.230Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An attacker could have leveraged the Windows Error Reporter to run arbitrary code on the system escaping the sandbox. *Note:* This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0749|2024-08-01T18:18:19.174Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A phishing site could have repurposed an `about:` dialog to show phishing content with an incorrect origin in the address bar. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122 and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-0753|2024-08-01T18:18:17.865Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In specific HSTS configurations an attacker could have bypassed HSTS on a subdomain. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-0742|2024-08-01T18:18:17.931Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: It was possible for certain browser prompts and dialogs to be activated or dismissed unintentionally by the user due to an incorrect timestamp used to prevent input after page load. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122, Firefox ESR < 115.7, and Thunderbird < 115.7.

item.title: CVE-2024-2611|2024-08-01T19:18:47.977Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A missing delay on when pointer lock was used could have allowed a malicious page to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-2610|2024-08-01T19:18:47.766Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Using a markup injection an attacker could have stolen nonce values. This could have been used to bypass strict content security policies. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-0754|2024-08-01T18:18:18.606Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Some WASM source files could have caused a crash when loaded in devtools. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122.

item.title: CVE-2024-3860|2024-07-30T19:53:06.739Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An out-of-memory condition during object initialization could result in an empty shape list. If the JIT subsequently traced the object it would crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.title: CVE-2024-3864|2024-07-24T19:40:13.901Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bug present in Firefox 124, Firefox ESR 115.9, and Thunderbird 115.9. This bug showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort this could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-4770|2024-07-23T16:32:22.116Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When saving a page to PDF, certain font styles could have led to a potential use-after-free crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4773|2024-07-23T16:35:01.918Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When a network error occurred during page load, the prior content could have remained in view with a blank URL bar. This could have been used to obfuscate a spoofed web site. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-6607|2024-07-17T20:21:05.514Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: It was possible to prevent a user from exiting pointerlock when pressing escape and to overlay customValidity notifications from a `<select>` element over certain permission prompts. This could be used to confuse a user into giving a site unintended permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Thunderbird < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6605|2024-07-17T15:22:59.569Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Firefox Android allowed immediate interaction with permission prompts. This could be used for tapjacking. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6607|2024-07-15T21:37:18.753Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: It was possible to prevent a user from exiting pointerlock when pressing escape and to overlay customValidity notifications from a `<select>` element over certain permission prompts. This could be used to confuse a user into giving a site unintended permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6603|2024-07-11T15:14:25.435Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In an out-of-memory scenario an allocation could fail but free would have been called on the pointer afterwards leading to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

item.title: CVE-2024-6613|2024-07-11T15:08:46.394Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The frame iterator could get stuck in a loop when encountering certain wasm frames leading to incorrect stack traces. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6611|2024-07-10T20:28:20.273Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A nested iframe, triggering a cross-site navigation, could send SameSite=Strict or Lax cookies. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6602|2024-07-10T20:14:24.710Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A mismatch between allocator and deallocator could have lead to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

item.title: CVE-2024-6608|2024-07-10T16:31:59.234Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: It was possible to move the cursor using pointerlock from an iframe. This allowed moving the cursor outside of the viewport and the Firefox window. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6615|2024-07-09T15:05:19.743Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 127. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-5693|2024-07-09T15:29:15.068Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Offscreen Canvas did not properly track cross-origin tainting, which could be used to access image data from another site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-6604|2024-07-09T15:06:06.130Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 127, Firefox ESR 115.12, and Thunderbird 115.12. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

item.title: CVE-2024-4774|2024-07-05T17:22:50.439Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The `ShmemCharMapHashEntry()` code was susceptible to potentially undefined behavior by bypassing the move semantics for one of its data members. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-1550|2024-07-05T17:21:44.306Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A malicious website could have used a combination of exiting fullscreen mode and `requestPointerLock` to cause the user's mouse to be re-positioned unexpectedly, which could have led to user confusion and inadvertently granting permissions they did not intend to grant. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2023-5388|2024-07-05T17:21:12.662Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: NSS was susceptible to a timing side-channel attack when performing RSA decryption. This attack could potentially allow an attacker to recover the private data. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-1546|2024-07-05T17:21:44.662Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When storing and re-accessing data on a networking channel, the length of buffers may have been confused, resulting in an out-of-bounds memory read. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1548|2024-07-05T17:21:47.586Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using a dropdown select input element. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1551|2024-07-05T17:20:59.781Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipart HTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type response header, as well as control part of the response body, they could inject Set-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-2611|2024-07-05T17:21:13.176Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A missing delay on when pointer lock was used could have allowed a malicious page to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-1552|2024-07-05T17:21:47.180Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Incorrect code generation could have led to unexpected numeric conversions and potential undefined behavior.*Note:* This issue only affects 32-bit ARM devices. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-5693|2024-06-21T18:15:56.931Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Offscreen Canvas did not properly track cross-origin tainting, which could be used to access image data from another site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-3854|2024-06-21T18:15:59.089Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In some code patterns the JIT incorrectly optimized switch statements and generated code with out-of-bounds-reads. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-5702|2024-06-21T18:15:54.214Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory corruption in the networking stack could have led to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-3861|2024-06-21T18:16:00.743Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If an AlignedBuffer were assigned to itself, the subsequent self-move could result in an incorrect reference count and later use-after-free. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-3852|2024-06-21T18:15:58.554Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: GetBoundName could return the wrong version of an object when JIT optimizations were applied. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-5700|2024-06-21T18:15:58.018Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 126, Firefox ESR 115.11, and Thunderbird 115.11. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-3302|2024-06-21T18:16:01.831Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: There was no limit to the number of HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames that would be processed. A server could abuse this to create an Out of Memory condition in the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-2608|2024-06-21T18:52:18.600Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: `AppendEncodedAttributeValue(), ExtraSpaceNeededForAttrEncoding()` and `AppendEncodedCharacters()` could have experienced integer overflows, causing underallocation of an output buffer leading to an out of bounds write. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-5690|2024-06-21T18:15:55.293Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By monitoring the time certain operations take, an attacker could have guessed which external protocol handlers were functional on a user's system. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5692|2024-06-21T18:15:56.403Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: On Windows 10, when using the 'Save As' functionality, an attacker could have tricked the browser into saving the file with a disallowed extension such as `.url` by including an invalid character in the extension. *Note:* This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5691|2024-06-21T18:15:55.850Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By tricking the browser with a `X-Frame-Options` header, a sandboxed iframe could have presented a button that, if clicked by a user, would bypass restrictions to open a new window. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-3859|2024-06-21T18:16:00.213Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: On 32-bit versions there were integer-overflows that led to an out-of-bounds-read that potentially could be triggered by a malformed OpenType font. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-5696|2024-06-21T18:15:57.462Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By manipulating the text in an `<input>` tag, an attacker could have caused corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-3857|2024-06-21T18:15:59.609Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The JIT created incorrect code for arguments in certain cases. This led to potential use-after-free crashes during garbage collection. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-3863|2024-06-21T18:16:01.262Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The executable file warning was not presented when downloading .xrm-ms files. *Note: This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-5688|2024-06-21T18:15:54.759Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If a garbage collection was triggered at the right time, a use-after-free could have occurred during object transplant. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5690|2024-06-14T03:55:35.603Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By monitoring the time certain operations take, an attacker could have guessed which external protocol handlers were functional on a user's system. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5689|2024-06-14T03:55:34.783Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In addition to detecting when a user was taking a screenshot (XXX), a website was able to overlay the 'My Shots' button that appeared, and direct the user to a replica Firefox Screenshots page that could be used for phishing. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5688|2024-06-14T03:55:33.281Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If a garbage collection was triggered at the right time, a use-after-free could have occurred during object transplant. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5699|2024-06-14T03:55:41.870Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In violation of spec, cookie prefixes such as `__Secure` were being ignored if they were not correctly capitalized - by spec they should be checked with a case-insensitive comparison. This could have resulted in the browser not correctly honoring the behaviors specified by the prefix. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5697|2024-06-14T03:55:41.098Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A website was able to detect when a user took a screenshot of a page using the built-in Screenshot functionality in Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5693|2024-06-14T03:55:38.688Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Offscreen Canvas did not properly track cross-origin tainting, which could be used to access image data from another site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.description: An attacker could have caused a use-after-free in the JavaScript engine to read memory in the JavaScript string section of the heap. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5698|2024-06-11T12:40:18.183Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By manipulating the fullscreen feature while opening a data-list, an attacker could have overlaid a text box over the address bar. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5694|2024-06-11T12:40:17.378Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An attacker could have caused a use-after-free in the JavaScript engine to read memory in the JavaScript string section of the heap. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5695|2024-06-11T14:03:31.199Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If an out-of-memory condition occurs at a specific point using allocations in the probabilistic heap checker, an assertion could have been triggered, and in rarer situations, memory corruption could have occurred. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5699|2024-06-11T12:40:18.427Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In violation of spec, cookie prefixes such as `__Secure` were being ignored if they were not correctly capitalized - by spec they should be checked with a case-insensitive comparison. This could have resulted in the browser not correctly honoring the behaviors specified by the prefix. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5696|2024-06-11T12:40:13.963Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By manipulating the text in an `<input>` tag, an attacker could have caused corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127 and Firefox ESR < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5697|2024-06-11T14:03:17.234Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A website was able to detect when a user took a screenshot of a page using the built-in Screenshot functionality in Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5690|2024-06-11T14:02:15.786Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By monitoring the time certain operations take, an attacker could have guessed which external protocol handlers were functional on a user's system. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127 and Firefox ESR < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5700|2024-06-11T16:16:40.610Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 126, Firefox ESR 115.11, and Thunderbird 115.11. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127 and Firefox ESR < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-5701|2024-06-11T12:40:18.692Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 126. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5687|2024-06-11T16:16:51.765Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If a specific sequence of actions is performed when opening a new tab, the triggering principal associated with the new tab may have been incorrect. The triggering principal is used to calculate many values, including the `Referer` and `Sec-*` headers, meaning there is the potential for incorrect security checks within the browser in addition to incorrect or misleading information sent to remote websites. *This bug only affects Firefox for Android. Other versions of Firefox are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127.

item.title: CVE-2024-5691|2024-06-11T12:40:13.093Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: By tricking the browser with a `X-Frame-Options` header, a sandboxed iframe could have presented a button that, if clicked by a user, would bypass restrictions to open a new window. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127 and Firefox ESR < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-1556|2024-06-04T18:01:33.835Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The incorrect object was checked for NULL in the built-in profiler, potentially leading to invalid memory access and undefined behavior. *Note:* This issue only affects the application when the profiler is running. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1557|2024-02-20T13:21:38.413Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 122. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1550|2024-02-20T19:23:36.552Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A malicious website could have used a combination of exiting fullscreen mode and `requestPointerLock` to cause the user's mouse to be re-positioned unexpectedly, which could have led to user confusion and inadvertently granting permissions they did not intend to grant. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1546|2024-02-20T19:23:30.714Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When storing and re-accessing data on a networking channel, the length of buffers may have been confused, resulting in an out-of-bounds memory read. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1547|2024-06-04T18:00:44.564Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Through a series of API calls and redirects, an attacker-controlled alert dialog could have been displayed on another website (with the victim website's URL shown). This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1551|2024-02-20T19:23:38.186Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipart HTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type response header, as well as control part of the response body, they could inject Set-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1548|2024-02-20T19:23:33.739Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using a dropdown select input element. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1552|2024-02-20T19:23:39.596Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Incorrect code generation could have led to unexpected numeric conversions and potential undefined behavior.*Note:* This issue only affects 32-bit ARM devices. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1553|2024-02-20T19:23:41.022Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 122, Firefox ESR 115.7, and Thunderbird 115.7. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1549|2024-02-20T19:23:35.141Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If a website set a large custom cursor, portions of the cursor could have overlapped with the permission dialog, potentially resulting in user confusion and unexpected granted permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1554|2024-02-20T13:21:37.414Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The `fetch()` API and navigation incorrectly shared the same cache, as the cache key did not include the optional headers `fetch()` may contain. Under the correct circumstances, an attacker may have been able to poison the local browser cache by priming it with a `fetch()` response controlled by the additional headers. Upon navigation to the same URL, the user would see the cached response instead of the expected response. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1555|2024-06-04T17:59:28.932Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When opening a website using the `firefox://` protocol handler, SameSite cookies were not properly respected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-29943|2024-03-22T12:55:39.866Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An attacker was able to perform an out-of-bounds read or write on a JavaScript object by fooling range-based bounds check elimination. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.0.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-29944|2024-03-22T16:18:28.977Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An attacker was able to inject an event handler into a privileged object that would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the parent process. Note: This vulnerability affects Desktop Firefox only, it does not affect mobile versions of Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124.0.1 and Firefox ESR < 115.9.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-4778|2024-06-04T17:56:34.311Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 125. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4774|2024-05-14T17:21:26.609Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The `ShmemCharMapHashEntry()` code was susceptible to potentially undefined behavior by bypassing the move semantics for one of its data members. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4775|2024-06-04T17:56:05.266Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An iterator stop condition was missing when handling WASM code in the built-in profiler, potentially leading to invalid memory access and undefined behavior. *Note:* This issue only affects the application when the profiler is running. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4764|2024-06-04T17:55:43.516Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Multiple WebRTC threads could have claimed a newly connected audio input leading to use-after-free. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4772|2024-05-14T17:21:26.111Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: An HTTP digest authentication nonce value was generated using `rand()` which could lead to predictable values. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4768|2024-05-14T17:21:24.047Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A bug in popup notifications' interaction with WebAuthn made it easier for an attacker to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4769|2024-05-14T17:21:24.318Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When importing resources using Web Workers, error messages would distinguish the difference between `application/javascript` responses and non-script responses. This could have been abused to learn information cross-origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4773|2024-05-14T17:21:26.363Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When a network error occurred during page load, the prior content could have remained in view with a blank URL bar. This could have been used to obfuscate a spoofed web site. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4765|2024-05-14T17:21:25.339Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Web application manifests were stored by using an insecure MD5 hash which allowed for a hash collision to overwrite another application's manifest. This could have been exploited to run arbitrary code in another application's context. *This issue only affects Firefox for Android. Other versions of Firefox are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4770|2024-05-14T17:21:24.594Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When saving a page to PDF, certain font styles could have led to a potential use-after-free crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4766|2024-06-04T17:54:37.373Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Different techniques existed to obscure the fullscreen notification in Firefox for Android. These could have lead to potential user confusion and spoofing attacks. *This bug only affects Firefox for Android. Other versions of Firefox are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4767|2024-05-14T17:21:23.746Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If the `browser.privatebrowsing.autostart` preference is enabled, IndexedDB files were not properly deleted when the window was closed. This preference is disabled by default in Firefox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4771|2024-06-06T19:52:20.334Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A memory allocation check was missing which would lead to a use-after-free if the allocation failed. This could have triggered a crash or potentially be leveraged to achieve code execution. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4776|2024-06-04T17:53:32.797Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A file dialog shown while in full-screen mode could have resulted in the window remaining disabled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126.

item.title: CVE-2024-4367|2024-05-14T17:21:23.486Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A type check was missing when handling fonts in PDF.js, which would allow arbitrary JavaScript execution in the PDF.js context. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.title: CVE-2024-4777|2024-05-14T17:21:24.864Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 125, Firefox ESR 115.10, and Thunderbird 115.10. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 126, Firefox ESR < 115.11, and Thunderbird < 115.11.

item.description: In certain cases the JIT incorrectly optimized MSubstr operations, which led to out-of-bounds reads. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.title: CVE-2024-3859|2024-06-11T12:40:15.584Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: On 32-bit versions there were integer-overflows that led to an out-of-bounds-read that potentially could be triggered by a malformed OpenType font. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-3863|2024-06-11T12:40:16.167Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The executable file warning was not presented when downloading .xrm-ms files. *Note: This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.description: The MarkStack assignment operator, part of the JavaScript engine, could access uninitialized memory if it were used in a self-assignment. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.description: It was possible to mutate a JavaScript object so that the JIT could crash while tracing it. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.description: In some code patterns the JIT incorrectly optimized switch statements and generated code with out-of-bounds-reads. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.title: CVE-2024-3865|2024-04-16T15:14:09.894Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 124. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.description: A use-after-free could result if a JavaScript realm was in the process of being initialized when a garbage collection started. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

item.description: GetBoundName could return the wrong version of an object when JIT optimizations were applied. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird < 115.10.

item.description: Memory safety bug present in Firefox 124, Firefox ESR 115.9, and Thunderbird 115.9. item.description: A use-after-free could occur during WASM execution if garbage collection ran during the creation of an array. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 125.

This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

item.title: CVE-2024-6609|2024-07-09T14:25:59.075Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When almost out-of-memory an elliptic curve key which was never allocated could have been freed again. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

item.title: CVE-2024-6603|2024-07-09T14:25:57.402Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: In an out-of-memory scenario an allocation could fail but free would have been called on the pointer afterwards leading to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

item.title: CVE-2024-5692|2024-07-31T19:40:41.013Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: On Windows 10, when using the 'Save As' functionality, an attacker could have tricked the browser into saving the file with a disallowed extension such as `.url` by including an invalid character in the extension. *Note:* This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 127, Firefox ESR < 115.12, and Thunderbird < 115.12.

item.title: CVE-2024-1549|2024-08-01T18:40:21.447Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: If a website set a large custom cursor, portions of the cursor could have overlapped with the permission dialog, potentially resulting in user confusion and unexpected granted permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1548|2024-08-01T18:40:21.403Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using a dropdown select input element. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1550|2024-08-01T18:40:21.314Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: A malicious website could have used a combination of exiting fullscreen mode and `requestPointerLock` to cause the user's mouse to be re-positioned unexpectedly, which could have led to user confusion and inadvertently granting permissions they did not intend to grant. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1554|2024-08-01T18:40:21.447Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The `fetch()` API and navigation incorrectly shared the same cache, as the cache key did not include the optional headers `fetch()` may contain. Under the correct circumstances, an attacker may have been able to poison the local browser cache by priming it with a `fetch()` response controlled by the additional headers. Upon navigation to the same URL, the user would see the cached response instead of the expected response. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1557|2024-08-01T18:40:21.450Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 122. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1556|2024-08-01T18:40:21.454Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: The incorrect object was checked for NULL in the built-in profiler, potentially leading to invalid memory access and undefined behavior. *Note:* This issue only affects the application when the profiler is running. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1552|2024-08-01T18:40:21.419Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Incorrect code generation could have led to unexpected numeric conversions and potential undefined behavior.*Note:* This issue only affects 32-bit ARM devices. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1551|2024-08-01T18:40:21.333Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipart HTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type response header, as well as control part of the response body, they could inject Set-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1555|2024-08-01T18:40:21.427Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When opening a website using the `firefox://` protocol handler, SameSite cookies were not properly respected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123.

item.title: CVE-2024-1547|2024-08-01T18:40:21.411Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: Through a series of API calls and redirects, an attacker-controlled alert dialog could have been displayed on another website (with the victim website's URL shown). This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

item.title: CVE-2024-1546|2024-08-01T18:40:21.460Z -- mozilla -- firefox
item.description: When storing and re-accessing data on a networking channel, the length of buffers may have been confused, resulting in an out-of-bounds memory read. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.
